signals.headline: AI voice agent market surged to $19.21B (2025), VC funding 7x in 2 years ($315M→$2.1B); ElevenLabs $3.3B, Giga $61M — voice AI replacing contact center workflows
signals.source: AgentVoice market analysis; TechCrunch; Yahoo Finance — Giga $61M raise; SiliconANGLE — VoiceRun $5.5M
signals.data_point: Conversational AI market $19.21B (2025) → $132.86B by 2034. VC into voice AI grew from $315M (2022) to $2.1B (2024). ElevenLabs $180M Series C at $3.3B. Giga raised $61M for enterprise voice automation. VoiceRun $5.5M seed. BFSI sector leads (32.9%), followed by healthcare/retail. Clients include Marriott, Caesars Entertainment.
signals.relevance: NEW CATEGORY — AI voice agents are a distinct model not captured in the engine. Contact center automation is a $45B market with massive VC activity. This is NOT the same as general conversational AI (V318-AGT-001) — it's a specific vertical application with different unit economics and competitive dynamics.
signals.verdict_detail: Engine has no model for enterprise AI voice agents replacing contact center IVR/human workflows. This is a $19B+ market with proven VC traction.

signals.headline: Synthetic data TAM $60-90B by 2030; projected 70% of AI training data by 2030; Synthesia $4B, enterprises pay $500K-$5M/yr for domain-specific datasets
signals.source: SeedTable synthetic data startups; CPO Magazine; TechCrunch — Synthesia valuation
signals.data_point: Synthetic data generation projected to account for 70% of AI training data by 2030 (up from 20% in 2025). TAM for specialized synthetic data $60-90B through 2030. Synthesia crossed $100M ARR, valued at $4B. Enterprises pay $500K-$5M/yr for domain-specific datasets. Domain expertise + regulatory compliance (HIPAA/GDPR) = moat hyperscalers lack.
signals.relevance: NEW CATEGORY — Synthetic data generation is a distinct infrastructure need not captured in engine. Different from general AI infrastructure (V41-INFRA-IT-001) because moat is domain expertise, not compute.
signals.verdict_detail: Engine has no model for synthetic data generation platforms. $60-90B TAM with enterprise willingness to pay $500K-$5M/yr.

signals.headline: EU AI Act compliance deadline August 2026 creates mandatory demand; penalties up to €35M/7% global turnover; insurers requiring adversarial red-teaming documentation
signals.source: Wilson Sonsini AI regulatory preview; CPO Magazine; Securiti EU AI Act analysis; Enkrypt AI compliance blog
signals.data_point: EU AI Act fully applicable August 2, 2026 for high-risk AI systems. Penalties: up to €35M or 7% global annual turnover. Insurers now require documented adversarial red-teaming and model-level risk assessments as prerequisites for underwriting. 175+ AI security startups funded. AI safety/compliance market emerging as distinct category.
signals.relevance: NEW CATEGORY — AI compliance/safety tooling is a regulatory-driven category not captured in engine. Mandatory demand (not optional adoption) created by EU AI Act + insurance requirements. Similar pattern to cybersecurity compliance after GDPR.
signals.verdict_detail: Engine has no model for AI safety/compliance/red-teaming platforms. Mandatory demand driver (EU AI Act) + insurance requirements create near-certain transformation.

signals.headline: LLMOps/AI observability: WitnessAI $58M for enterprise AI governance; trust/observability funding surging as AI scales from cloud to edge
signals.source: SiliconANGLE; EU-Startups — LangWatch €1M; Arize AI; W&B Weave
signals.data_point: WitnessAI closed $58M for enterprise AI security/governance (monitoring, controlling AI agent interactions with sensitive data). LangWatch €1M pre-seed for LLMOps monitoring. Arize AI and Weights & Biases expanding into LLM-specific observability. Funding flowing into trust, observability, and autonomy at every layer of AI stack.
signals.relevance: NEW CATEGORY — LLMOps/AI observability is an emergent infrastructure need distinct from general MLOps. As AI agents proliferate, monitoring/governance becomes critical. WitnessAI's $58M raise signals enterprise readiness.
signals.verdict_detail: Engine has no model for LLMOps/AI observability platforms. Distinct from general IT infrastructure — specific to LLM/agent monitoring and governance.

signals.headline: Agentic AI coding: Cursor $500M ARR, Devin/Cognition $10.2B valuation, Windsurf acquired — market consolidating into IDE+agent platforms
signals.source: Crunchbase — Cursor $2.3B financing; TechCrunch — Cognition acquires Windsurf; Faros AI agentic coding review
signals.data_point: Cursor ARR skyrocketed to $500M. Cognition (Devin) raised $400M at $10.2B valuation, then acquired Windsurf. Devin price dropped from $500→$20/mo. 85% developers use AI coding tools. Cursor CEO: 20% of coding workflows handled by agents by 2026. Market consolidating: Cognition+Windsurf, GitHub Copilot, Cursor as top 3.
signals.relevance: VALIDATES C7-NR-12 T-score increase from Cycle 0. Further evidence: Cursor's $500M ARR and Devin's $10.2B valuation confirm AI code gen is the strongest F1 signal in the engine. Market is consolidating fast — moat increasing for leaders.
signals.verdict_detail: C7-NR-12 T-score of 65.0 (corrected in Cycle 0) further validated. Market validation now overwhelming: $500M ARR (Cursor), $10.2B valuation (Devin), 85% developer adoption.

signals.headline: GovTech procurement AI: Starbridge $42M, PermitFlow $31M, OpenGov at $1.8B — GovTech startups 30% more likely to reach Series A
signals.source: GovTech.com — Starbridge; Government Technology Insider; Crunchbase — OpenGov $1.8B; SeedTable GovTech startups
signals.data_point: Starbridge (procurement AI) raised $42M ($10M seed + $32M Series A by Craft Ventures). PermitFlow $31M Series A. OpenGov agreed to sell at $1.8B valuation. GovTech Series A progression rate jumped from 18%→23% (2016-2025), 30% increase. Average investment $15.2M/round across 1,180+ rounds. Hazel AI automates full procurement lifecycle.
signals.relevance: VALIDATES REQ-TN-008-ACCESS for GovTech/procurement sub-segment of TN-008. Software layer of government/defense is accessible — proven by funding activity. Supports both MC-V50-DEF-001 and PC8-SC-GOVTECH-01.
signals.verdict_detail: GovTech procurement software accessible to startups. Starbridge $42M and OpenGov $1.8B prove fund-returner potential in government SaaS.

signals.headline: Commercial drone delivery/inspection: Zipline $600M at $7.6B, 2M+ deliveries; Dronamics $58M; Voltair infinite-range power-line drones
signals.source: TechCrunch — Zipline $600M; Robot Report — 2M deliveries; SeedTable drones; Drone Girl
signals.data_point: Zipline raised $600M at $7.6B valuation, plans expansion to 4+ US states in 2026. Surpassed 2M commercial drone deliveries. Dronamics $58M (~$200M valuation) for cargo drones. Voltair builds drones that charge on transmission lines (infinite range for grid inspection). Matternet $74M for medical supply delivery. Total drone startup funding >$2B.
signals.relevance: VALIDATES decomposition opportunity. Drone inspection/delivery is distinct from V3-DEF-001 (military drone swarm). Commercial drone software/operations layer is ACCESSIBLE while military platform layer remains LOCKED.
signals.verdict_detail: Commercial drone inspection/delivery is accessible — Zipline $7.6B proves fund-returner potential. Distinct from military drone platforms (V3-DEF-001).

signals.headline: AI agent infrastructure validated: 40% enterprise apps agentic by 2026 (Gartner); $89.6B market; what_needed infrastructure genuinely more necessary
signals.source: Gartner forecast; multiple VC reports; AI agent market projections
signals.data_point: Autonomous AI agent market projected $89.6B by 2030. Gartner: 40% enterprise apps will have agentic capabilities by 2026. Infrastructure for agent deployment (orchestration, observability, guardrails) is precondition for agent adoption. Enterprise needs: monitoring, compliance, multi-agent coordination, tool integration.
signals.relevance: VALIDATES REQ-ROLE-TN-010 — infrastructure (what_needed) models in TN-010 genuinely score higher on T because agent infrastructure is prerequisite. The role_score_paradox is structural, not artifact.
signals.verdict_detail: Infrastructure for AI agents (what_needed) is genuinely more structurally necessary than individual agent businesses (what_works). The 2.1-point T gap is real.

signals.headline: AI funding closed 2025 with record $238B across 1,850+ deals; Q1 2026 $13B+ in January alone — F4_capital enrichment further confirmed
signals.source: AI Funding Tracker; Crunchbase AI sector
signals.data_point: Total AI funding in 2025: $238B across 1,850+ deals (record). Q1 2026 opening: $13B+ in January alone. Nearly half of ALL global venture funding went to AI-related companies in 2025. F4_capital force driving fund-returner concentration is validated by unprecedented capital deployment.
signals.relevance: FURTHER VALIDATES REQ-FVCR-F4_capital. The 11.2% fund-returner rate for F4_capital models (vs 7.1% baseline) is real — capital is genuinely concentrating in F1×F4 intersection.
signals.verdict_detail: F4_capital enrichment is structural, not scoring artifact. $238B in AI funding confirms capital is the strongest force multiplier.

signals.headline: Physical AI robotics: Figure AI $39B valuation, Q1 2026 $2.26B in robotics funding, humanoid robots entering production
signals.source: Multiple VC reports; Figure AI valuation; robotics funding trackers
signals.data_point: Figure AI reached $39B valuation. Q1 2026 saw $2.26B in robotics startup funding. Skild AI raised $1.4B at $14B valuation for robotics foundation models. Capital rotating from digital to physical AI. Manufacturing/logistics labor shortage acute: 600K+ unfilled manufacturing positions, 650K construction.
signals.relevance: VALIDATES MC-V50-ROBO-001 (created Cycle 0). Robotics middleware/integration platform thesis strengthened. Figure AI's $39B valuation suggests the hardware layer may also be more accessible than initially scored.
signals.verdict_detail: Physical AI robotics thesis validated by Figure AI $39B and $2.26B Q1 2026 funding. MC-V50-ROBO-001 scores confirmed.

signals.headline: Warehouse robotics software layer accessible: orchestration needs growing as multi-vendor robot fleets deployed
signals.data_point: Warehouse fulfillment increasingly uses multi-vendor robot fleets (AMRs from different OEMs). Orchestration layer needed to coordinate heterogeneous fleets. Software-layer warehouse robotics distinct from hardware-platform level. MC-V38-44-002 (Warehouse Fulfillment Robotics Platform, T=76.2 O=41.0) has a software orchestration sub-layer that is more accessible.
signals.relevance: DECOMPOSITION candidate — MC-V38-44-002 T>>O gap of 35.2 can be partially resolved by decomposing into software orchestration layer (accessible) vs hardware platform (locked).
signals.verdict_detail: MC-V38-44-002 should be decomposed: warehouse robotics software orchestration layer is accessible, hardware platform remains locked.

signals.headline: Autonomous trucking middleware: software stack separating from hardware; fleet management SaaS layer accessible
signals.source: Industry analysis; autonomous vehicle market patterns
signals.data_point: MC-V312-TRN-001 (Autonomous Trucking Middleware, T=81.2 O=47.5) gap of 33.8. The 'middleware' itself suggests accessible layer but O=47.5 (CONTESTED). Fleet management SaaS and route optimization layers more accessible than AV hardware stack. Software layer companies (fleet management, routing, load matching) funded at smaller scale but with clearer path to revenue.
signals.relevance: Score adjustment candidate — MC-V312-TRN-001 already positioned as middleware (not hardware), suggesting MO may be slightly underscored. The model name implies software layer but O-score reflects hardware-adjacent friction.
signals.verdict_detail: MC-V312-TRN-001 MO may be underscored by 1pt. Middleware/software stack is more accessible than overall AV market suggests.

signals.headline: Earth observation analytics decomposition: software analytics layer accessible while satellite/sensor platform locked
signals.source: Industry analysis; satellite imagery market patterns
signals.data_point: V3-DEF-007-L4 (Intelligent Commercial Earth Observation Analytics, T=73.2 O=36.5) gap of 36.7. The analytics layer (computer vision on satellite imagery for commercial applications — agriculture, insurance, construction monitoring) is distinct from satellite platform. Analytics-only companies (Planet Labs customers, not competitors) are accessible startups.
signals.relevance: DECOMPOSITION candidate — commercial earth observation analytics is accessible as analytics-only play, while satellite platform ownership remains locked.
signals.verdict_detail: V3-DEF-007-L4 should be decomposed: satellite imagery analytics (commercial) is accessible, satellite platform ownership is locked.

signals.headline: Defense AI software accessibility confirmed: software sub-layer VC $7.7B while platform/procurement remains locked — defense tension is structural decomposition
signals.data_point: Defense models with T>>O (V3-DEF-002 gap=40.5, V3-DEF-004 gap=40.0, V3-DEF-001 gap=35.8, MC-DEF-012 gap=33.2) are structurally locked at platform level. MC-V50-DEF-001 (created Cycle 0) captures the accessible software layer. Remaining defense T>>O tensions are now EXPLAINED — these are observation-only models (high T, low O = transformation certain but door closed).
signals.relevance: VALIDATES that defense T>>O models don't need further decomposition — MC-V50-DEF-001 already captures the accessible layer. Remaining tensions are structural features, not scoring errors.
signals.verdict_detail: Defense T>>O tensions are structural (platform lock). MC-V50-DEF-001 captures accessible layer. No further decomposition needed for V3-DEF-002/004/001.

new_model_candidates.name: Enterprise AI Voice Agent Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: Conversational AI $19.21B market, VC 7x growth to $2.1B. ElevenLabs $3.3B, Giga $61M. Distinct from general agent platforms — specific contact center economics.

new_model_candidates.name: Domain-Specific Synthetic Data Generation Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: TAM $60-90B by 2030. 70% of AI training data by 2030. Synthesia $4B. Domain expertise + compliance = moat vs hyperscalers.

new_model_candidates.name: AI Safety & Compliance Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: EU AI Act Aug 2026 mandatory. Penalties €35M/7% turnover. Insurers requiring red-teaming. 175+ startups. Regulatory-driven demand (like GDPR→cybersecurity).

new_model_candidates.name: LLMOps & AI Agent Observability Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: WitnessAI $58M. As AI agents proliferate, monitoring/governance critical. Emergent infrastructure layer.

new_model_candidates.name: Commercial Drone Inspection & Delivery Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: Zipline $7.6B, $600M raise, 2M+ deliveries. Accessible commercial layer distinct from military drone platforms.

new_model_candidates.name: AI-Powered Government Procurement Platform
new_model_candidates.rationale: Starbridge $42M, OpenGov $1.8B. GovTech fundability up 30%. Procurement automation distinct from general GovTech.
